metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6905 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The read_image_tga function in gd_tga.c in the GD Graphics Library (akalibgd) before 2.2.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read) via a crafted TGA image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.3
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.3').
